JUDGES: Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;Elisabeth Steiner;George Nicolaou;Khanlar Hajiyev;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicant is a member of the “ PERSON Gemeinden in GPE , which became a registered religious community ( eingetragene ORG ) under LAW CARDINAL ( Bundesgesetz über die PERSON religiösen GPE ) on DATE .

CARDINAL . DATE the applicant attended the DATE course of the PERSON theological seminary ( GPE ) in GPE . Since then he has been giving religious instruction to the youth and has been working as a municipal preacher ( Prediger ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed a request with the Federal Minister for ORG ( ORG ) for recognition as a conscientious objector ( ORG ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Minister for ORG recognised the applicant as a conscientious objector . Accordingly , he was exempted from the duty to perform military service but liable to perform civilian service ( Zivildienst ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested the Minister of ORG to apply section CARDINAL LAW in conformity with the LAW and to exempt him from the obligation to perform civilian service . He submitted that this provision exempted members of recognised religious societies who performed specific services relating to worship or religious instruction from the obligation to perform civilian service , whereas he , as a student of the theological seminary GPE Chrischona , had a comparable clerical position within a registered religious community , namely the “ PERSON Gemeinden in GPE . Consequently , he should be also exempted from civilian service .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Minister of ORG dismissed the applicant 's request . The decision referred to the findings of ORG ) in a decision of DATE , in which it had held that exemption from the obligation to perform civilian service under section CARDINALa of LAW merely applied to members of recognised religious societies and could not be extended to members of registered religious communities .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed a complaint with ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declined to deal with the complaint for lack of prospects of success .
CARDINAL . On the applicant 's request ORG transmitted his complaint to ORG ( Verwaltungsgerichtshof ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant supplemented his complaint .
On DATE ORG , referring to the above - mentioned decision of CARDINAL DATE by ORG , dismissed the complaint . This decision was served on the applicant 's counsel on DATE .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINALa § CARDINAL of LAW ( PERSON ) provides as follows :
“ An exemption from the obligation to perform civilian service shall apply to the following members of recognised religious societies :
CARDINAL . NORP persons involved in spiritual welfare or in clerical teaching after graduating in theological studies ,
CARDINAL . NORP members of a religious order who have made a solemn vow , and
CARDINAL . NORP students of theology who are preparing to assume a clerical function . ”
CARDINAL . For a detailed description of the legal situation in GPE in this field see GPE v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , CARDINAL DATE .
